```{r}
# Create data
sample_names <- c("zihe_1", "iisa_3", "uilk_3", "xojn_3", "qehq_3", "eipl_1", "letw_1", "sojd_3", "poih_4", "joxm_1")
no_of_cells <- c(26, 108, 201, 333, 442, 543, 756, 880, 1049, 1328)
pearson <- c(0.77, 0.85, 0.87, 0.88, 0.88, 0.88, 0.84, 0.88, 0.89, 0.89)

# Create data frame
data <- data.frame(sample_names, no_of_cells, pearson)

# Plot
plot(data$no_of_cells, data$pearson, 
     xlab = "Number of Cells", 
     ylab = "Pearson Correlation", 
     main = "Pearson Correlation vs No. of Cells",
     pch = 19,
     col = "darkblue",
     ylim = c(0.70,0.95))
text(data$no_of_cells, data$pearson, labels = data$sample_names, pos = 3, cex = 0.7, col = "black")
```
